Sequence Information.Peptide Name: mini-ChBac7.5Nbeta (Pro-rich; PrAMPs, Arg-rich, natural AMPs; Minibactenecin; Goat cathelicidin, ruminant, mammals; animals; UCLL1, BBL. Parent: ChBac7.5)

Literature Information.Literature: Discovery: isolated neutrophils of the domestic goat.Sequence analysis: APD analysis reveals this sequence is most similar (95.45%) tomini-ChBac7.5NalphaIt corresponds to the N-terminal 21 residue of bactenecin 7.5. P: 38%; R: 52%.Activity: active against E.coli ATCC 25922, ML35p, or M17 (MIC1-2 uM), P. aeruginosa ATCC 27853, clincla strains (MIC 2 uM), Klebsiella spp. clinical isolate  (MIC 4 uM), A. baumannii clinical isolate (MIC 4 uM), L. monocytogenes EGD (MIC 2 uM), M. luteus CIP A270 (MIC 1 uM), S-aureus ATCC 25923 or 710A or MRSA (MIC > 64 uM), S-intermedius clin. isolate (MIC >64 uM),  C-albicans 820 (MIC >64 uM), and C-parapsilosis (MIC > 64 uM). Bound to LPS in vitro.Toxicity: not hemo.lytic till 100 uM. No toxicity to other mammalian cells tested till 30 uM.The parent peptide ChBac7.5 (seq: RRLRPRRPRLPRPRPRPRPRPRSLPLPRPQPRRIPRPILLPWRPPRPIPRPQPQPIPRWL) was predicted but has never been isolated and reproted yet. Replaced 7/2021.
Literature Information.Author: Shamova OV, Orlov DS, Zharkova MS, Balandin SV, Yamschikova EV, Knappe D, Hoffmann R, Kokryakov VN, Ovchinnikova TV. 2016
Literature Information.Title: Minibactenecins ChBac7.Nalpha and ChBac7. Nbeta - Antimicrobial Peptides from Leukocytes of the Goat Capra hircus
